data.title: Unimpressive chocolate; delicious sorbet
data.text:
My husband and I went in for a tasty treat and had a mixed experience. When we tried to confirm with the (hopefully new) employee that the sorbet was dairy free, she looked at as oddly and told us that it were primarily made with milk.  When we asked if she was sure, she walked us over to the case, looked at the guide, and said, "yep, it has dairy."  We looked at the guide and saw that it specifically said "dairy-free."  Once we got that cleared up, we got the Blood Orange Sorbetto, and it was fantastic!  So delicious!

We also got a few chocolates, and were surprised when they rang up a $3 a pop. We were also surprised at how disappointing they were. My husband couldn't taste the Baileys in the Baileys Cream Fudge; my Devils Food Truffle was underwhelming and surprising crunchy for something made with cake crumbs, and the Dark Chocolate Orange's filling was off-puttingly grainy.  Between the price and their appearance (they were beautiful) we expected much more, but at the end of the day, they need to taste good; these missed the mark. 

We won't return for the chocolates or the service, but we might return for the sorbet.

data.title: Nice treat after an historic downtown meal
data.text: We really enjoy the restaurants in historic downtown Bryan. After dinner one evening we were just walking around and we wandered in the Chocolate Gallery. What a treasure! We all had some type of treat and we were amazed at the cakes being constructed in the glassed-in kitchen. It is now a regular part of a trip downtown.

data.title: Sweet surprise
data.text: Stopped here while on a date with my husband. We loved it! He had the chocolate cupcake and I chose the carrot cake cupcake. They were both delicious, huge, and had about 3 inches of icing on top! We also tried the chocolates which are a little pricy but definitely worth the cost. The key lime flavor was my favorite and my husband loved the coffee flavor. They also have ice cream, cheesecake, and we saw them working on wedding cakes too. This place is definitely a sweet surprise! Stop by and experience it for yourself, you'll love it!

data.title: Clean and delicious!
data.text: Came with family for dessert after graduation. Very impressed with the cleanliness, variety of desserts (chocolates, gelato, cakes) and watching the chefs make creations in viewing area. Loved the quaint village area location.

data.title: Amazing!!!
data.text: Loved watching the Chocolatiers making these goodies!!! The candies were amazing, wonderful bits of joy!!! Plenty of amazing flavors and desserts to choose from. Will stop in again, hopefully soon!

data.title: Yummers!
data.text:
Stopping for a afternoon break we experienced fabulous chocolate. We also viewed chocolate made to look like many kinds of art objects.
There were other things to order that came from Ciana's cakes. 
You can watch the chocolate and the cakes being made. It will make you hungry. There were delightful French macaroons, almond cookies and shortbread cookies plus many more. Everything we tasted was perfect. We will go back.

data.title: Fun and delicious for dessert!
data.text: The gelato and pecan shortbread are to die for!  It's fun to watch the pastry chefs work their magic in their huge kitchen on the spot!  I'm not a chocoholic, but my friends crave the chocolates made here.

data.title: A "sweet" surprising find in an Old Town!
data.text:
Great selection of high end chocolate!  A fun novelty while shopping in downtown Bryan!  Choices ranged from normal to more artsy - as did prices!  

Perfect if you want to calm that sweet tooth!

data.title: Fabulous field trip!
data.text: My first graders had a blast at the chocolate gallery. Everyone was so informative and they made it interesting for both students and adults. The kids loved tasting the chocolate and were blown away by all the delicious chocolates in display. Definitely going back next year!

data.title: Tasty Treats!
data.text: Not sure how we got so lucky to have such a place with amazing chocolates, creative cakes, tasty cupcakes/ cookies, and creamy gelato, but we are indeed blessed.  The owners are service oriented, classically trained, and welcome additions to our community.  No trip is complete to downtown Bryan without sampling something delicious.

data.title: Wonderful!!!!
data.text: The Chocolate Gallery is so fun!  It is a working chocolate/bakery kitchen with full glass windows so you can watch the professional bakers as they work. The desserts are also awesome!! They have hand made chocolate pieces and sculptures. They also have cupcakes, decorated cookies and Gelato. If you are an Aggie there is an added bonus of chocolate ring replicas and crests.

data.title: Wow
data.text: The gelato is awesome along with all of the other chocolate delights including the truffles, cupcakes, cookies..........could go on forever
